message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to reproduce both little “houses” exactly as shown.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Overall, there are two separate structures:

  LEFT STRUCTURE (“Small House”)
  – Blocks Used:  
    ◦ Two Green cubes stacked (2× index 2).  
    ◦ One Orange “roof” block on top (index 11).  
    ◦ Two Orange triangular wedges, one on each side (index 14 for the left wedge, index 15 for the right wedge).  
  – Layering:  
    ◦ Bottom layer: One green cube.  
    ◦ Second layer: One green cube + the two orange wedges attached at mid‐height.  
    ◦ Top layer: Orange roof block.  

  RIGHT STRUCTURE (“Tall Tower with Arch Top”)
  – Blocks Used:  
    ◦ Two Tall Green rectangular pillars (2× index 4).  
    ◦ One Long Yellow rectangular beam bridging the pillars (index 5).  
    ◦ One Red cube on top of the beam (index 3).  
    ◦ One Blue cube on top of the red cube (index 1).  
    ◦ One Yellow half‐cylinder arch on top (index 6).  
  – Layering:  
    ◦ Bottom layer: Two tall green pillars.  
    ◦ Second layer: Long yellow beam bridging the pillars.  
    ◦ Third layer: Red cube set on the beam.  
    ◦ Fourth layer: Blue cube on top of the red cube.  
    ◦ Fifth layer: Yellow half‐cylinder crowning the top.  

•  Total Block Count:  5 blocks in the small house + 6 blocks in the tall tower = 11 blocks.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Required Dictionary Indices (with exact orientations):

 • Index 1  (Blue cube)  
 • Index 2  (Green cube) × 2  
 • Index 3  (Red cube)  
 • Index 4  (Tall green rectangular block) × 2  
 • Index 5  (Long yellow rectangular beam)  
 • Index 6  (Yellow half‐cylinder, curved top)  
 • Index 11 (Orange “roof” shape)  
 • Index 14 (Orange triangular wedge)  
 • Index 15 (Orange triangular wedge)  

──────────────
NOTE  
──────────────
• All blocks must be used exactly as shown in the dictionary; no rotation beyond what is presented is allowed.  
• The same block index may appear more than once if needed (e.g., two tall green pillars both use index 4).  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‑BY‑STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 2    // Place bottom green cube (left structure)
  Step2:  Move block with index 2    // Stack second green cube (left structure)
  Step3:  Move block with index 14   // Attach left‐side orange wedge
  Step4:  Move block with index 15   // Attach right‐side orange wedge
  Step5:  Move block with index 11   // Place the orange roof piece on top
  Step6:  Move block with index 4    // First tall green pillar (right structure)
  Step7:  Move block with index 4    // Second tall green pillar (right structure)
  Step8:  Move block with index 5    // Lay yellow beam across the two pillars
  Step9:  Move block with index 3    // Set red cube on top of the central beam
  Step10: Move block with index 1    // Stack blue cube above the red cube
  Step11: Move block with index 6    // Cap with yellow half‐cylinder
}

Following these steps with the listed block orientations will recreate the target scene exactly as shown.
